intro: Lepidaploa silvae, commonly known as the forest lepidaploa, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in temperate forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
